label: 京童
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: The first of the proper guidebooks to Kyoto...written in 1658 by a physician, Nakagawa Kiun.  The account starts with the palace and proceeds to shrines, temples, famous sights, and historical remians, in all 88 places in the capital and its environs (p. 735). [中川喜雲]
